Introduction:

Contractors working on construction projects in New South Wales may face unexpected delays that can impact the project's completion time. In such situations, requesting an extension of time may be necessary. However, the process of applying for an extension of time can be complex and time-consuming, requiring contractors to provide evidence and follow specific procedures. In this article, we will provide a step-by-step guide on how contractors can apply for an extension of time in writing. By understanding the requirements and steps involved, contractors can ensure that their requests are considered and avoid any disputes that may arise from delays in project completion.
Write me the "- Details of Delay" part of the article in 100 words.

The next crucial element to include in your written request for an extension of time is the details of the delay. You need to provide a clear and concise explanation of what caused the delay and how it affected your ability to complete the project on time. Be sure to include any supporting evidence, such as weather reports or delivery receipts, that can help bolster your case. It is essential to be as specific as possible when describing the delay and its impact on the project timeline. This will help the other party better understand the situation and make an informed decision about whether to grant the extension of time.
